message.content:
cs.DM, cs.IT, cs.FL, cs.CC, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the construction of infinite words with specific properties, which is a topic in discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The use of continued fraction algorithms suggests a connection to information theory (cs.IT) and the study of complexity functions. The concept of uniformly balanced words is related to formal languages and automata theory, which falls under the category of formal languages and automata (cs.FL). The problem of constructing words with specific properties can also be approached using computational complexity theory (cs.CC). Finally, the use of algorithms and numerical methods suggests a connection to numerical analysis (cs.NA).
